AccountingPoint.title: AccountingPoint
AccountingPoint.description: An administrative point where Energy Supplier change can take place and for which commercial business processes are defined.

mRID.description:
A unique identification of the measurement point.

In the ESMP context, the "model authority" is defined as an authorized issuing office that provides an agreed identification coding scheme for market participant, domain, measurement point, resources (generator, lines, substations, etc.) identification.

Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is globally unique within an exchange context.
Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID for the mRID. It is strongly recommended to do this.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

name.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

Asset.title: Asset
Asset.description: asset is an energy data space specific attribute referring to the Asset from which data is being requested

meterId.description: meterId is an energy data space specific attribute that specifies the id of the meter that measures the asset.

operatorId.description: operatorId is an energy data space specific attribute that specifies the id operator of the asset refered to.

type.description: type is an energy data space specific attribute that specifies type of asset refered to.

MessageDocumentHeader.title: MessageDocumentHeader
MessageDocumentHeader.description: MessageDocumentHeader  is an energy data space specific entity with the creationDateTime of this document.

creationDateTime.description: The date and time the MessageDocumenHeader was created.

MetaInformation.title: MetaInformation
MetaInformation.description: MetaInformation is an energy data space specific entity referring to the information concerning the technical and functional context of the MarketDocument.

connectionId.description: connectionId is an energy data space specific attribute referring to the established connection used for the communication of this document.

dataNeedId.description: dataNeedId is an energy data space specific attribute holding the type of data need requested, like ‘last 24 hours at 1 hour interval”.

dataSourceId.description: dataSourceId is an energy data space specific attribute referring to the datasource from which the requested data is being queried.

defaultValues.description: defaultValues is a energy data space specific attribute to hold relevant default values. The format to use can freely be chosen based on the implementation. Most commonly you would expect a semi-colon separated name value pair, like: "minPower=value; maxPower=value; avgPower=value".

documentType.description:
documentType is an energy data space specific attribute referring to the type of document, comparable to the MessageTypeList in the CIM part of the message.
Note:
This is applicable if you have the need to know the content without having to open the complete document. DocumentType might contain messages not (yet) part of the MessageTypeList.

finalCustomerId.description: The finalCustomerId  is an energy data space specific attribute identifying the actor doing the request for data or data sharing.

regionConnector.description: regionConnector is an energy data space specific attribute that specifies the regional connector being used to retrieve the data requested.

regionCountry.description: regionCountry is an energy data space specific attribute that specifies the country where the regional connector is located.

requestPermissionId.description:
The requestPermissionId is energy data space specific identification attribute holding an unique identifier issued by the energy data space to allow for tracing of the permission through serveral message exchanges.
Note: the requestPermissionId is NOT the identifier issued by the Identity Service Provider as specified in the EU Implementing Act on access to Metering and Consumption Data.

mRID.description:
Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID,  as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552 Edition 1, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

createdDateTime.description: Date and time this activity record has been created (different from the 'status.dateTime', which is the time of a status change of the associated object, if applicable).

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

name.description: The name is any free human readable and possibly non unique text naming the object.

reason.description: Reason for event resulting in this activity record, typically supplied when user initiated.

status.description: Information on consequence of event resulting in this activity record.

type.description: Type of event resulting in this activity record.

code.description: The motivation of an act in coded form.

text.description: The textual explanation corresponding to the reason code.

Request_Permission.title: Request_Permission
Request_Permission.description: Specific right or authorisation granted to individuals or entities to access certain resources, perform specific actions, or obtain certain privileges within a system or organisation.

createdDateTime.description: The date and time of the creation of the permission.

RequestPermission_Envelope.title: RequestPermission_Envelope
RequestPermission_Envelope.description: The envelope entity  is a non-CIM object used in an energy data space environment to serve as a central top-level entity connecting the MarketDocumentHeader (energy data space specific context information block) with the regular CIM MarketDocument.

RequestPermission_MarketDocument.title: RequestPermission_MarketDocument
RequestPermission_MarketDocument.description: An electronic document containing the information necessary to satisfy the requirements of a given business process.

mRID.description:
The unique identification of the document being exchanged within a business process flow.

In the ESMP context, the "model authority" is defined as a party (originator of the exchange) that provides an identification in the context of a business exchange such as document identification, ...

Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is globally unique within an exchange context.
Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID for the mRID. It is strongly recommended to do this.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

description.description: The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy.

period.timeInterval.description: The start and end date and time for a given interval.

process.processType.description:
The identification of the nature of process that the document addresses.
--- The Process associated with an electronic document header that is valid for the whole document.

receiver_MarketParticipant.mRID.description:
The identification of a party in the energy market.

In the ESMP context, the "model authority" is defined as an authorized issuing office that provides an agreed identification coding scheme for market participant, domain, measurement point, resources (generator, lines, substations, etc.) identification.

Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is globally unique within an exchange context.
Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID for the mRID. It is strongly recommended to do this.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.
--- The MarketParticipant associated with an electronic document header.

receiver_MarketParticipant.marketRole.ty.description:
The identification of the role played by a market player.

--- The MarketParticipant associated with an electronic document header.
--- The role associated with a MarketParticipant.

revisionNumber.description: The identification of the version that distinguishes one evolution of a document from another.

sender_MarketParticipant.mRID.description:
The identification of a party in the energy market.

In the ESMP context, the "model authority" is defined as an authorized issuing office that provides an agreed identification coding scheme for market participant, domain, measurement point, resources (generator, lines, substations, etc.) identification.

Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is globally unique within an exchange context.
Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID for the mRID. It is strongly recommended to do this.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.
--- The MarketParticipant associated with an electronic document header.

sender_MarketParticipant.marketRole.type.description:
The identification of the role played by a market player.

--- The MarketParticipant associated with an electronic document header.
--- The role associated with a MarketParticipant.

type.description: The coded type of a document. The document type describes the principal characteristic of the document.

TimeSeries.title: TimeSeries
TimeSeries.description:
A set of time-ordered quantities being exchanged in relation to a product.
In the ESMP profile, the TimeSeries provides not only time-ordered quantities but also time-ordered information.

mRID.description:
A unique identification of the time series.

In the ESMP context, the "model authority" is defined as a party (originator of the exchange) that provides a unique identification in the context of a business exchange such as time series identification, bid identification, ...

Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is globally unique within an exchange context.
Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID for the mRID. It is strongly recommended to do this.
For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.

MeasurementPointID_String.title: MeasurementPointID_String
MeasurementPointID_String.description:
The coded identification of a domain covering a number of related objects, such as metering point, accounting point, etc.

In the ESMP context, it is an authorized issuing office that provides an agreed identification coding scheme for measurement point identification.

ESMP_DateTime.title: ESMP_DateTime
ESMP_DateTime.description: In ESMP, the dateTime shall be expressed in UTC as YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ.

ReasonCode_String.title: ReasonCode_String
ReasonCode_String.description: The coded motivation of an act.

Status_String.title: Status_String
Status_String.description: The identification of the status of an object.

ReasonText_String.title: ReasonText_String
ReasonText_String.description: The textual explanation of an act as a string of characters.

ID_String.title: ID_String
ID_String.description:
A code to uniquely distinguish one occurrence of an entity from another.

In the ESMP context, the code is defined either by:
- an emitting company that provides an agreed identification unique within a business context such as capacity auction identification, market agreement identification, etc.
- a party (originator of the exchange) that provides a unique identification in the framework of a business exchange such as document identification, time series identification, bid identification, ...

ESMPVersion_String.title: ESMPVersion_String
ESMPVersion_String.description:
In ESMP, the coded value is restricted to digits.

A code that distinguishes one evolution of an identified object from another. Information about a specific object may be sent several times, each transmission being identified by a different version number.

MessageKind_String.title: MessageKind_String
MessageKind_String.description: The coded type of a document.

PartyID_String.title: PartyID_String
PartyID_String.description:
The identification of an actor in the energy market.

In the ESMP context, it is an authorized issuing office that provides an agreed identification coding scheme for market participant identification.

MarketRoleKind_String.title: MarketRoleKind_String
MarketRoleKind_String.description: The identification of the role played by a party.

ProcessKind_String.title: ProcessKind_String
ProcessKind_String.description: The coded identification of the nature of process.

YMDHM_DateTime.title: YMDHM_DateTime
YMDHM_DateTime.description: In ESMP, the date and time is expressed as "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ", which conforms with ISO 8601 UTC time zone. This date and time is without the seconds.

value.description: The date and time as "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ", which conforms with the ISO 8601 UTC time zone.

ESMP_DateTimeInterval.title: ESMP_DateTimeInterval
ESMP_DateTimeInterval.description: This datatype enables to express the start date and time, and the end date and time of a time interval with a specific pattern. This pattern is the YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmZ.

start.description: The start date and time of the interval with a minute resolution.

end.description: The end date and time of the interval with a minute resolution.
